Precedence: bulk



Hello and greetings from the Mother Earth Sound System!

We're a collective who have been throwing free outdoor parties around the 
Bay Area since the spring of 1993. Our love of Mother Earth, music, and 
grooving with people brought us together to put on parties, and now we 
want to come together with you. We'll be travelling around North America 
this coming fall, and are trying to establish as many connections now as 
we can.

Our collective right now includes four djs and a visual artist 
(projections, banners, etc), as well as a variety of musicians, 
artists, drummers, and friends that help us party from time to time, 
thus making the "Mother Earth Sound System" a loosely-defined group of 
people that basically just love to party.  However, our interest in 
coming to your town is not to just come throw a party, but to make ties 
with people...to exchange ideas (we do a zine with this in mind), to 
share talents (swapping records and mixtapes is always fun), and most of 
all, to share each other's company. 

We will be travelling as light as possible, so the more contacts we can 
make beforehand the better...if you can help us hook up additional 
sound/visual equipment, spaces to party, places to crash, or whatever, 
please let us know.  Our (us and you) success in this venture depends 
very much on how well we can work together to make it a truly collective 
effort.  Please understand that this appeal is directed not just to local 
party promoters and the like, but to _anyone_ interested in what we're 
doing (as a sound system and as a global "movement")...so if any of this 
perks your interest, tell us!  Tell us what you think of our proposal, 
whether you and people in your area are interested, what's happening in 
your area, what you would like to happen, etc. etc.   Let's start getting to 
know each other now and when fall rolls around, we'll be ready to rock!


Peace + respect,

			*****************************
			* MOTHER EARTH SOUND SYSTEM *
			* ------------------------- *
			* UNITE  CELEBRATE  SURVIVE *
			* ------------------------- *
			* >>>RESPECT YOUR MOTHER<<< *
			*****************************

From sfraves-owner  Wed Feb 15 19:41:00 1995
Return-Path: owner-sfraves
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.9/8.6.5) id TAA27031; Wed, 15 Feb 1995 19:41:00 -0800

Received: from localhost by nexsys.nexsys.net (8.6.5/SM-8.6.4)
	id TAA05654; Wed, 15 Feb 1995 19:43:35 -0800
Date: Wed, 15 Feb 1995 19:43:35 -0800
From: geoffw@nexsys.net (Geoff White)
Message-Id: <199502160343.TAA05654@nexsys.nexsys.net>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: Re: Full Moon in Berkeley
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk




	Yes the full moon did and didn't happen,  the big party in the
	aquatic park was foiled by the Police, basically the workers
	in the adjacent industrial area complained to the cops about the
	ravers parking and making noise so once a complaint was made the
	cops were oblidged to shut down the party (they got to the sound
	system as it was being set up).  I talked to one Berkeley cop
	who was quite nice and he told me that even though they often know
	we are there, if there are no complaints they can choose to ignore
	us but once 911 is called and there is a record they have to 
	respond.  It seems that once the word went out, lots of people 
	descended on the area and you can guess what happened after that.

	Anyway, he said that we couldn't have the party in Berkeley that 
	night. We told him we were just trying to regroup and would be out
	of his hair, which we did, the small warehouse where we all
	wound up was really cozy and intimate and totally renewed my faith
	in the Scene (at least for another month :)  It was nice to get
	a good groove on after a long hiatus.  After Markie,Garth and Thomas
	finished their trade off thing, Rebecca took the tables and played
	some really nice morning Trip-Hop complete with some really nice
	and accomplished scratching (yes ! and it worked too!)

	All in all a very nice party for those who had the energy and 
	devotion to find it.

				G

Dear Sfraves;

	Speaking of police; I had my first run in ever with a motorcycle 
cop; I've only been here in Cali for 4 months now, but in all my life 
I've never been harassed by a cop on a motorcycle. It kinda went like 
this; I was sitting in the UNICAL 76 station at the corner of University 
and I think Martin Lurter King; listining to Fad Gadget Down Under the 
Flag which I had cranked. I have an 84 Jeep Cherokee Wagoneer with a 
Pioneer CD 25watts a channel into 2 6.5 in MTX Coxial speakers mounted in 
the door; not what you would call a block blaster by any means. This cop 
as i'm sitting waiting for an open pump pulles over this womyn in a truck 
for reasons unknown to me. Gets off his bike and walks up to me and askes 
me is there any reason why I'm listining to my sterreo so loud. I told 
him it was a good song : For WHom the Bell Tolls I thing it was. He then 
proceeded to hassel me about the level of the music; the fact that i 
didn't have a seat belt bla bla bla ...etc. This is Berkeley right don't 
they have better things to do? Gee; obviously someone didn't get laided 
lastnight; what a pin head. I'm sorry for bitchin but I just don't 
understand why this had to happen. What a waist of tax payers money.

		Peace & Love From Across Cyberspace
		   aka Brian Darkness, LMT
		   (510)-254-0933 CT Active

From: sfraves-owner
To: socal-raves; fl-raves; mtn-raves; mw-raves; ne-raves; nw-raves; 
pb-cle-raves; se-raves; tx-raves; dc-raves
Cc: sfraves; smithbr; djstonie; whitsitt
Subject: Travelling SF Sound System
Date: Wednesday, February 15, 1995 5:17PM



Hello and greetings from the Mother Earth Sound System!

We're a collective who have been throwing free outdoor parties around the
Bay Area since the spring of 1993. Our love of Mother Earth, music, and
grooving with people brought us together to put on parties, and now we
want to come together with you. We'll be travelling around North America
this coming fall, and are trying to establish as many connections now as
we can.

Our collective right now includes four djs and a visual artist
(projections, banners, etc), as well as a variety of musicians,
artists, drummers, and friends that help us party from time to time,
thus making the "Mother Earth Sound System" a loosely-defined group of
people that basically just love to party.  However, our interest in
coming to your town is not to just come throw a party, but to make ties
with people...to exchange ideas (we do a zine with this in mind), to
share talents (swapping records and mixtapes is always fun), and most of
all, to share each other's company.

We will be travelling as light as possible, so the more contacts we can
make beforehand the better...if you can help us hook up additional
sound/visual equipment, spaces to party, places to crash, or whatever,
please let us know.  Our (us and you) success in this venture depends
very much on how well we can work together to make it a truly collective
effort.  Please understand that this appeal is directed not just to local
party promoters and the like, but to _anyone_ interested in what we're
doing (as a sound system and as a global "movement")...so if any of this
perks your interest, tell us!  Tell us what you think of our proposal,
whether you and people in your area are interested, what's happening in
your area, what you would like to happen, etc. etc.   Let's start getting to 

know each other now and when fall rolls around, we'll be ready to rock!


Peace + respect,

                        *****************************
                        * MOTHER EARTH SOUND SYSTEM *
                        * ------------------------- *
                        * UNITE  CELEBRATE  SURVIVE *
                        * ------------------------- *
                        * >>>RESPECT YOUR MOTHER<<< *
                        *****************************

Mr Darkness,
> Being a Cancer born on the 4th of July
> I have never been to a full moon.
> V-Day has always been a very bad day ...

I was also born on the 4th of July and I've never been to a full moon
either but this Valentine's Day was a very Very Good Day!!  I'll spare
you the details (ok, my first paper was accepted for publication) 
and Then
I went (beaming love) over to the city (anyone else just feel like
San Francisco was gonna explode with happiness on Tuesday???) 
and Then
fueled by the mysterious force of St Valentine I went to the DeHaro
party.  My 2-bit summary: felt like a Hardkiss Glamour production.
Definite shades of hollywood with disappearing chill rooms and
an early shutdown.  Crowd was on the young side.  I saw some
friends and beer was cheaper than the water (go figure).
Basically nothing could've shaken my mood :^)
and so Then
directions to the full moon were readily available
from folks running back and forth between 181 and DeHaro and being
lovingly removed from the building around 3:30 (after Mr H's one
turntable finale set) I was off for Home Sweet Home - after all, if I was
gonna find this full moon I needed some Lunch!!  A sandwich, chips, and 
soda later (maybe about 4:30) I tooled down to the Marina only to find
a heavy police presence - On Bull Horns "get in your cars and vacate 
the city".  I drove up to an officer who diligently searched my car
with his flashlight and confirmed that it was Not Happening.
Undaunted, I parked a few blocks away and set out into the park
hoping to run into any stragglers and see if it was moved.  I played
hide and go seek with 10+ cop cars in the park and on the tracks only
to find a few people who also didn't know where to go.  The full moon
was Beautiful on the water !!

Love Ya,
Dave

Hi all - thanks to Brian for taking care of this list the last couple
of weeks.  I spent that time working in Tokyo.  Highlight of the trip
was a visit to Yellow which was featuring NY's Danny Tenaglia and local
DJ Akai.  Both spun some great stuff and the locals were really getting
into it.  I'll try to write a (outsider's) guide to the scene when I 
get time. 

This weekend, Digitaria seems to be the main event, with guests
db, Josh Wink and Keoki; should be a great night of musique, and a big
crowd.  Sunday's Spundae has an all-star lineup too, and try checking
out Komotion on Friday night...

Date: 2/15/95 9:12 PM
To: Rick Guthrie
From: Brian Darkness
Dear Sfraves;

	Speaking of police; I had my first run in ever with a motorcycle 
cop; I've only been here in Cali for 4 months now, but in all my life 
I've never been harassed by a cop on a motorcycle. It kinda went like 
this; I was sitting in the UNICAL 76 station at the corner of University 
and I think Martin Lurter King; listining to Fad Gadget Down Under the 
Flag which I had cranked. I have an 84 Jeep Cherokee Wagoneer with a 
Pioneer CD 25watts a channel into 2 6.5 in MTX Coxial speakers mounted in 
the door; not what you would call a block blaster by any means. This cop 
as i'm sitting waiting for an open pump pulles over this womyn in a truck 
for reasons unknown to me. Gets off his bike and walks up to me and askes 
me is there any reason why I'm listining to my sterreo so loud. I told 
him it was a good song : For WHom the Bell Tolls I thing it was. He then 
proceeded to hassel me about the level of the music; the fact that i 
didn't have a seat belt bla bla bla ...etc. This is Berkeley right don't 
they have better things to do? Gee; obviously someone didn't get laided 
lastnight; what a pin head. I'm sorry for bitchin but I just don't 
understand why this had to happen. What a waist of tax payers money.

>.... I was sitting in the UNICAL 76 station at the corner of University
>and I think Martin Lurter King; listining to Fad Gadget Down Under the
>Flag which I had cranked....

What time of day was it?

Hey, man, I live right next to an all night gas station. At night, when I
am trying to enjoy the silence or my own personal music in my room, I don't
like to hear intrusive music blasting. I know how groovy it is to hear your
own music in the car, but... Even if you don't have a loud-ass system, the
threshhold of the neighbors sound level is definitely crossed.

As Lou Harrison said: Cherish, Consider, Create.

This is not a flame, it is just a perspective for your consideration.

peace,
Greg

Dear Greg;

	2pm in the middle of the afternoon; the traffic was so loud that I
couldn't even hear all of what the cop was telling me; even with my music
turned off. No he was just hasseling me; for sure. Ya know sound is a
funny thing; I just pulled out my ISO (International Organization for
Standards) #35 for Acoustics. Its not necessaially how loud something is; 
its a combination of many factors frequency, duration, sound pressure
level, sound power level, sound intensity level; and can be very
subjective. Obviously every human being is different; with that each of
our ears person to person is different as are our individual ears. So with
reference to law enforcement supposing to be a science, without a
calibrated measuring device tracable to NIST (National Insitute of
Standards & Techonology); formerly NBS;  law enforcement officials
shouldn't be able to at least bring into court any evidence to whether or
not something is too loud or not; yet they do. Its like taking you to
court for a speeding ticket without assigning a value to it; Oh he or she
was speedin; well how fast were they going; ah I don't know. Thats why
they have radar guns and speedometers which are calibrated and traceable to
NIST; so why not for sound levels? Whats wrong with this picture? So if
you ever get cited for disturbing the pleace these are things you should
bring up in your defense. By the way; with reference to radar guns; the
guns themselves aren't really calibrated; its the tuning fork they use to
calibrate the radar gun thats traceable. Yes a tuning fork which they
smack on the dashboard set to 91.7GHz I believe and hold it in front of
the radar gun;  These forks are calibrated for sertate speeds 50mph, 60mph
...etc. And if the speed denoted on the fork is the same thats displayed
on the LED display then its calibrated. Ew Ew what techonogly at work. I
used to be a Test Engineer so this is my field of expertise. Radar guns
are a lot of fun; especially when you have one and you drive down the road
zapping the cops; the perplexed look they get on their faces is worth a
million laughs; trust me. 

		Peace & Love From Across Cyberspace
		    aka Brian Darkness, LMT

		Internet:	brianv@liberty.com
		Alt. Internet:	brianvan@liberty.com
		Majornet:	Brian Darkness @LIB
		Worldlink:	Brian Darkness @LIB; Stop by and will chat
		Chatlink:	System #48; ditto
		IRC:		Channel #rave; ditto

		Net Person & Virtual Cybernetic Being
			(FUKENGRUVEN:)

        "San FranDisco Ravers List" <sfraves@hyperreal.com>
Subject: DeHaro V-Day // Re: Full Moon
In-reply-to: Your message of "Thu, 16 Feb 95 11:31:57 PST."
             <9502161931.AA28480@bethe.ucdavis.edu> 
Date: Thu, 16 Feb 95 19:41:40 -0800
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

> I went (beaming love) over to the city (anyone else just feel like
> San Francisco was gonna explode with happiness on Tuesday???) 

Yes!

If anyone knows the real deal on the DeHaro V-day party, I'd like to
hear it!

> and Then
> fueled by the mysterious force of St Valentine I went to the DeHaro
> party.  My 2-bit summary: felt like a Hardkiss Glamour production.
> Definite shades of hollywood with disappearing chill rooms and
> an early shutdown.  Crowd was on the young side.  I saw some

Yeah, that was a weird party; I didn't see a single face I recognized,
but this didn't matter. For the first time in many years, I decided to
play along with this valentine's day thing -- got me a V-day date and
everything...

After an hour there, we had just started to get comfortable dancing; we
were hearing Andre Lucero spin some groooovy sounds (what da heck do
you call his kind of music?) when eventually the lights went up and
stayed up for a very long time. Since all the brightness was annoying,
we chilled in the car for a while, howled at the moon, etc. No sign of
a chill room anywhere either. Eventually, we go back in, lights still
on full blast, dance a few more minutes, then it shuts down.  We had
expected the party to go till 6AM, like any self-respecting party
should.

Not desirous to drive home right then we decided to explore the
building by vaulting over some chairs blocking a hallway; in the
closing hubbub, we weren't noticed by any security and had full run of
the building, which was quite interesting, and only partially inhabited
by businesses. (A new building, I guess)...

We evaded the security guards for about 2 hrs by stealthily ducking
into various mysterious dark side rooms, chilling out, having fun, and
discovering a beautiful (well to us) fullmoonlit garden of eden in the
back of the building. Around 4AM a security guard found us lolligagging
in the garden (actually, we were extremely lost by then anyways) and
escorted us out into the night.

So despite the disappointment in the v-day party, we managed to make the
best of the situation.

	Niels.

> 
> Dear Greg;
> 
> 	2pm in the middle of the afternoon; the traffic was so loud that I
> couldn't even hear all of what the cop was telling me; even with my music
> turned off. No he was just hasseling me; for sure. Ya know sound is a
> funny thing; I just pulled out my ISO (International Organization for
> Standards) #35 for Acoustics. Its not necessaially how loud something is; 
> its a combination of many factors frequency, duration, sound pressure
> level, sound power level, sound intensity level; and can be very
> subjective. Obviously every human being is different; with that each of
> our ears person to person is different as are our individual ears. So with
> reference to law enforcement supposing to be a science, without a
> calibrated measuring device tracable to NIST (National Insitute of
> Standards & Techonology); formerly NBS;  law enforcement officials
> shouldn't be able to at least bring into court any evidence to whether or
> not something is too loud or not; yet they do. Its like taking you to
> court for a speeding ticket without assigning a value to it; Oh he or she
> was speedin; well how fast were they going; ah I don't know. Thats why
> they have radar guns and speedometers which are calibrated and traceable to
> NIST; so why not for sound levels? Whats wrong with this picture? So if
> you ever get cited for disturbing the pleace these are things you should
> bring up in your defense. By the way; with reference to radar guns; the
> guns themselves aren't really calibrated; its the tuning fork they use to
> calibrate the radar gun thats traceable. Yes a tuning fork which they
> smack on the dashboard set to 91.7GHz I believe and hold it in front of
> the radar gun;  These forks are calibrated for sertate speeds 50mph, 60mph
> ...etc. And if the speed denoted on the fork is the same thats displayed
> on the LED display then its calibrated. Ew Ew what techonogly at work. I
> used to be a Test Engineer so this is my field of expertise. Radar guns
> are a lot of fun; especially when you have one and you drive down the road
> zapping the cops; the perplexed look they get on their faces is worth a
> million laughs; trust me. 
> 
> 

jeez... I wish u'd start using paragraphs!

hugz

------- Forwarded Message

<forwards removed>

- ---------- Forwarded message ----------
>TO: All NRDC Earth Advocates
>FROM: John H. Adams, Executive Director
>Subject:  ATTEMPT TO DISMANTLE OUR ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS
>
>        I want to update you on the situation in Congress and ask you to
>make your voice heard there right away.
>        Congress is now moving at breakneck speed to enact into law a
>section of the Contract with America  that is so environmentally
>destructive, ITS REAL CONTENTS HAVE BEEN KEPT CAREFULLY HIDDEN FROM THE
>AMERICAN PUBLIC.
>        This legislative bombshell is deceptively titled the "Job
>Creation and Wage Enhancement Act." In reality, 70 of its 82 pages are
>devoted to one goal:DISMANTLING THE VITAL FRAMEWORK OF LAWS THAT NOW
>SAFEGUARD AMERICA'S ENVIRONMENT AND HUMAN HEALTH.
>        Let me repeat: Congress could vote in a matter of weeks on an Act
>that would sweep away virtually every legal barrier that now shields us
>against polluted air, toxic waste, rampant logging, deadly oil spills,
>and dozens of other environmental threats.
>        How could such a dangerous legislation get so far with so little
>public attention? I'll tell you how: its authors and corporate sponsors
>have disguised the true destructive intent of this radical proposal.
>        This massive sneak attack has been so successful that even
>Business Week magazine -- one of the few publications to pay attention --
>is calling the Job Act a "stealth environmental policy" that amounts to
>"a guerilla war on green laws."
>        Make no mistake: the sponsors of the so-called Job Act know that
>Americans would not AND DID NOT vote against the environment on Election
>Day.  In fact, the Contract with America that was so widely advertised
>BEFORE the elections never even mentioned the word "environment."  It was
>only AFTER the elections that Newt Gingrich and his allies released their
>true anti-green agenda.
>        Their blueprint for environmental destruction is buried inside
>the fine print of the sadly-misnamed Job Act. Instead of directly
>attacking popular laws like the Clean Air Act and Clean Water Act, THE
>JOB ACT WILL SIMPLY DISMANTLE THEM RULE BY RULE.
>        If there was truth in advertising, this legislation would be
>called THE POLLUTERS BILL OF RIGHTS because it would blatantly hand
>polluters new and unprecedented powers to evade, veto, or cripple
>environmental laws.
>        NRDC attorneys have completed a thorough analysis of this
>POLLUTERS BILL OF RIGHTS. Here are a few of its most frightening highlights:
>
>                1. THE RIGHT TO EVADE ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS
>
>        The act would give polluters and other special interests the
>right to compensate if they claim an environmental rule reduces the value
>of their property by 10%. About all they would have to do is send a
>letter demanding payment and the government would have to make them a
>cash offer. In the meantime, the government would have to cease its
>environmental protection controls.
>        RESULT: MORE CLEARCUTTING. MORE STRIP-MINING. MORE OIL DRILLING.
>Polluters and exploiters will claim it is too costly to obey the laws
>which control their devastating activities. So we  will have to pay off
>companies TO OBEY THE LAW. In this Alice-in-Wonderland world, you and I
>will be paying polluters NOT to pollute. If we refuse to pay  this
>blackmail  we may have to let them destroy the environment!
>
>                2. THE RIGHT TO VETO ENVIRONMENTAL RULES
>
>        The Act would create new panels of "outside experts" with VETO
>POWER over environmental rules. And it would allow these panels to be
>made up of "experts" EMPLOYED BY THE POLLUTERS. In other words: the
>corporate fox will run the hen house.
>        RESULT: MORE AIR POLLUTION. MORE OIL SPILLS. MORE POISONED
>DRINKING WATER. Industry's regulatory hit-men will simply veto new rules
>that would clamp down on dangerous threats to our environment. Our
>children will be hardest hit since their bodies are most vulnerable to
>toxic chemicals.
>                3. THE RIGHT TO CRIPPLE ENVIRONMENTAL RULES
>
>        The Act will paralyze environmental protection by requiring
>agencies to produce an avalanche of new "cost-benefit" studies and
>"risk assessments" before they can issue a rule. And polluters will have
>the right to sue the EPA BEFORE it proposes a rule, WHEN it proposes the
>rule, AFTER the rule is issued  and WHEN THE RULE IS ENFORCED> While its
>lawyers have a field day, the polluters get to keep on polluting!
>        RESULT: MORE LUNG DISEASE. MORE CANCER. MORE CONTAMINATED FOOD.
>If air polluters, or sewage dumpers, or pesticide makers don't like an
>environmental  control, it's no problem! They can just  sic their
>lawyers on the EPA while they continue to pollute. We pay the price in
>doctors bills and lost wages.
>
>                4. THE RIGHT TO AVOID PROSECUTION
>
>        The Act will give environmental violators an arsenal of new
>weapons with which to dodge prosecution. For example, the government
>would have to "tip off suspected lawbreakers before inspecting them so
>they can have a lawyer or accountant present! With that warning, the
>polluters can clean up falsified records or hide illegally dumped chemicals.
>        RESULT: MORE POLLUTED RIVERS. MORE ILLEGAL DUMPING. MORE
>ABANDONED MINES. Corporations will be able to poison or destroy your
>local environment, then use delaying tactics and technical defenses to
>walk away scot-free. They even have the right to sue government employees
>PERSONALLY to scare them off the case!
>
>        Now that you know what is in the so-called Job Act, I trust that
>you are horrified as I am at its vision for our future. Yes, our
>environmental laws may still exist on the books -- but they will be
>lifeless and irrelevant. Giant polluting corporations will control the
>regulatory process while they run roughshod over our environment.
>        In short, this Act will turn back the clock by 25 years -- TO A
>TIME WHEN OUR ENVIRONMENT HAD NO PROTECTION A ALL.  We will live once
>again with uncontrolled smog, dead lakes and rivers, strip-mined
>landscape, treeless forests and dying wildlife.
>        But most shocking of all: THIS POLLUTERS BILL OF RIGHTS COULD BE
>ENACTED WITHOUT AMERICANS EVEN KNOWING IT EXISTS-- because Congress is
>rushing this "stealth" act to a vote before the public can find out
>what's in it.
>                        MAKE YOUR VOICE HEARD IN CONGRESS!
>
>        1. CALL THE WESTERN UNION "CONTRACT HOTLINE" AT 1-800-651-1424
>        (the call costs $8 and can be billed to your telephone, Visa, or
>        Mastercard.You can call 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.)
>
>        2. CALL OR FAX YOUR CONGRESSPERSONS
>
>                WHERE TO CALL: Call Capitol Switchboard at 202-224-3121.
>        Ask to be connected to the office of your Senator or Representative.
>                WHERE TO FAX: Call the Capitol Switchboard and speak to
>        the office of your Congressperson. Tell them you are a constituent
and
>        need their fax number in order to send an urgent message.
>
>                        PLEASE ACT TODAY. WE WILL NOT GET A SECOND
>                        CHANCE. THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP AT THIS CRITICAL
TIME.
>
>National Resources Defense Council- 40 West 20th Street, New York, NY 10011
>
>
------- End of Forwarded Message

by and large, the fed has had a VERY poor record controlling pollution;
  the environment should IMHO be considered a local issue, anyway.

when shit starts seeping out of sewers into the middle of the street
  in front of yuppie mini-mansions, there will be action taken. rest
    assured. the NIMBY law overrides all other legislation ;)

seriously, this could backfire in the newt's fat face, because of local
  people acting up.  if the fed had NO CONTROL over companies like
    lousiana pacific or weyerhauser, there would also be no backroom
      deals, since the slushfunds couldn't go anywhere.

this should be taken as just another call to THINK GLOBALLY,ACT LOCALLY.

Dave SCruton

 Brian laments of his run-in with Berkeley's finest:
>This is Berkeley right don't they have better things to do? 
>I just don't understand why this had to happen.
 >What a waist of tax payers money.

In my case, the cop pulled over THREE WHOLE CARS at the same time, and
dissaproved of my very fine bell bottoms, so I called him a meter-maid with
a gun.

So he called me a punching bag and demonstrated a carotid choke hold on my
person, and threw aforementioned ass in jail.

COPS SUCK. COPS ABUSE POWER. Maybe not in Northern Exposure, but in real
life, real cities, they come on with attitude, and don't accept any in
return.

I know, I know, lay low, be a sheep in wolf's clothing, but I got my ass
kicked. And he was in an ornery mood when he hassled Brian.  Sometimes we
get some cool ones, it derives from our energy as well, but there are some
evil ones out there. Bullies with authority who have betrayed the trust
that we have given them, when we let them have this power.

Like the cops who took their badges off when they crashed a party at 1144
howard, and arrested 6 people, pounded three and used the word "nigger" as
freely as they wanted.

Like the cops in windbreakers over their badges, who stormed 938's new
year's party.

Like the cops who do shit like this all the time.

Like the cops who are not loved. Sucks, but they don't want our love. They
won't get my hate,either, and as little power as I can let them.

Remeber what the next Friends & Family party is about, good people, and
spread the word of what it will benefit. Unite our efforts, like a lens
concentrates the sun, and we can change anything we want.

Lotsa love 
 from one in the hive..........

From sfraves-owner  Fri Feb 17 12:22:52 1995
Return-Path: owner-sfraves
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.9/8.6.5) id MAA29970; Fri, 17 Feb 1995 12:22:52 -0800
Received: from mail06.mail.aol.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.6.9/8.6.5) with ESMTP id MAA29962; Fri, 17 Feb 1995 12:22:46 -0800
From: RobertJ308@aol.com
Received: by mail06.mail.aol.com
	(1.37.109.11/16.2) id AA177542536; Fri, 17 Feb 1995 15:22:16 -0500
Date: Fri, 17 Feb 1995 15:22:16 -0500
Message-Id: <950217150508_24580272@aol.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Cc: RobertJ308@aol.com
Subject: McDoc Martin & Overdub Tribe (a satire)
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Geez................,

I tried to remember a time I had gone out to and event in SF on a Friday,
and somehow my besotted brain couldn't come up anything from out of the
"way-back-machine" files. So, imagine my horror when I arrived at 1015 Folsum
to actually "dance" this past Friday.

Who were these "semi-unclothed and unclean"  unravers who actually go out to
clubs NOT to dance to the music. Who are these unflegeling unenlightened
unpeople who are cluttering up the spiritual tranquillity of my dance world?

I know, I know,  the  the evolution of the Homo Unraver Sapiens is a slow and
sappy one.  Up!!!  from the tawdry and slimy club pits, where barely
pubescent life forms, struggle to cope with the tingling sensations of their
naughty parts.  Up!!! from the smoke-filled SOM meat-markets where the dating
game gong show oozes along eternally and repetitously through the muck of
spermatozical history. 

So, on Friday while I was dancing, I saw a little beached unraver lying in
the corner.  As I knelt down beside him, I ascertained that he was drunk to
the point of where his life force was endangered.  But, as he looked up at
me, a puff of tobacco smoke came out of his mouth, and he said weakly,
"Babes, I want more babes!!!" Babes!!!Babes!! Babes!!!!   he cried.

 Even in the face of genetic extinction, this unraver cried out for
 procreation!!! I was in awe!!!!!!

Well, I knew I was too far away to take him to the nearest emergency ward,
but I KNEW that is not what he needed.  I should take him home and subject
him to two non-stop weeks of candy-flipping shock therapy.  All the while,
reading passages from the Ram Dass' book,  HOW CAN I HELP   Also, a steady
stream of vocal samples like "You've got to believe in something, Why not
believe in Me,'  could be playing in the background.  Yeah!!!I could
introduce him to all my bi-sexual friends, and then he would never be in need
of a date of Friday night!!!!!!

But, as he lay there, I wondered what the whole would look like if he were
"enlightened" like me. I probably wouldn't be able to buy any of my favorite
tapes from Ameba. They would always be out. I probably wouldn't be able to
get into any of my clubs, even the ones I now loved to hate. And there just
wouldn't be any room for me on the dance floor,  even if I did get in!!!!!!
The Full Moon's would be have to canceled because of "too many" people
attending. And, I probably could never a get a phone call through to my
connection. That's it!!! I cried. Now you and your kind have gone too
far!!!!!!!!


No,  wait a minute, as I looked "down" on this little unraver, I smiled with
 newfound insight and respect. San Francisco is the "best of all possible
worlds, " and  "God is a raver who dances in heaven," (and sometimes at DV8),
and Jesus, I'm lucky to here at all,  on the dance floor listening to McDoc
Martin and the OverDubtribe.!!!!!!

Yes!!Yes!!!Yes!!! it weren't for these alcohol filled, tobacco smoking,
lust-driven, homophobic unravers, I wouldn't be dancing my happy little
e-soaked ass off right now!!!  The mother of all Epiphanies!!!!!!!!!
    Hosea & Right On!!!!!!!!!


So, I went right over to the bar.  Bought him another drink, bummed two
carmel unfiltered cigarettes, and talked the most beautiful, large breasted
girl I could find into coming over and "ministering" to him.  Babes!!! he
gurgled happily, and I knew this "scene" crisis had passed. There was a place
for him in the world, and I had returned him to it.  Dante was right!!! We
are not punished FOR our sins, but BY THEM!!!!!

Now that my world had snapped back into perspective, I again began to look
for my  place to dance, and mind my own miniscule, cosmic, comic business.
   robertj.......monterey

dEAR mILTON;

	I'm sure you wouldn't joke about something like that; I'm just 
sitting here; tring to remember that line from Rick Wakemans Journey to 
the Center of the Earth that descibes what I felt as I read what happened 
to you it goes sorta like this; Dumbed with astonishment which bordered 
on stupification (with mouth open). As you said cops suck!!!!! If you 
were here I'ld give you a big hug; I'm soo sorry that had to heappened to 
you. People wonder why society has a tendcey to be so fucked up; how can 
one wonder when there are sooo may victums walking around. Its sad. I 
remember sitting in a doctors office reading a Time Magazine; I saw a 
picture of a 7 year old Bosian boy lying on the ground in a pool of his 
own blood. The caption read boy shot by sniper. What kinda animal lowers 
x-hairs ona 7 year old and pulls the trigger; I just started crying. When 
is the violence going to stop; when will people realize that it just 
doesn't work and only brings more violence.

Even better, why the heck are we sending the Mexican govt. 40 BILLION 
dollars in loans and aid in order to shore up their ailing economy, 
WITH NO STRINGS ATTACHED ON HUMAN RIGHTS OR FOLLOWING DEMOCRATIC
PROCEDURE! Meanwhile, that 40Billion dollars could be used on useful
things here at home, like infrastructure, or education, health-care,
etc.

"They" claim that this aid is needed because having the Mexican govt
fall could cause a recession on the whole amerikkkan kkkontinent.
Others claim that the failure of mexico would cause even more illegal
immigation into the US.... However, IMHO, the real reason is that
Mexico's failure would mean big losses for all those large US companies
that have recently  laid off workers in the US to move their
labor-intensive operations into mexico -- the NAFTA-enabled smooth
operation of their exploitation plants would be fucked by the resulting
economic/political instability. All those CEO's would have to give up
those big fat multimillion dollar bonuses they gave themselves when
they realize they're going to have to rehire all that expensive
unionized labor in the US.... As far as I'm concerned, I say fuck these
corporations, foreign investment/business is supposed to be risky, so
don't expect the government to bail you out (or rather bail out the 
country into which you've been investing and setting up off-shore ops)
when your greed outpaces reality.

So what if some greedy CEO can't afford that third yacht and the
vacation mansion in hawaiii... so what if Wal Mart had to cancel the
opening of more stores in Mexico because of the economic problems
there. Tough shit -- or like I've been saying recently
	"The right to profit is not a natural law"...

Ob-rave: hey, what's that song that goes 
"doo deeee dooo dum, boom boom boom"?

Date: Fri, 17 Feb 1995 14:37:41 -0800
From: Anatole Menon-Johansson <prav@embezzle.Stanford.EDU>
To: noise@kzsu.Stanford.EDU
Cc: anatole@embezzle.Stanford.EDU
Subject: Massacre in the Chiapas fwd message was DISINFORMATION


I have just finished an interview with Professor George Collier in the
Anthropology department here in Stanford.  I will be putting the content
of this interview out on Monday, on inside Stanford at 5.30pm.  
Professor Collier has just written a book on the Zapatista movement, its
history, politics and aims and he has a doctoral student working at this
moment in San Cristobal de las Casas.

Professor Collier also received the well intentioned email about a possible
massacre and immediately phoned his doctoral student in San Cristobal.  She
(the doctoral student) said that all was peaceful in San Cristobal and 
there was no evidence of any fighting.

I checked the AP wire today for stories about Chiapas and the only story
on Mexico which may be linked to the situation was an explosion of a 
gas pipeline in the state of Tabasco.  Professor Collier told me today
that the internet is full of propaganda from both sides.  So beware to
confirm reports before you take them to heart.

Keeping you informed.

Anatole

From: gabe@SIRIUS.COM (Gabe)
Subject: Re: Massacre in the Chiapas fwd message was DISINFORMATION (fwd)
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Here is some information that I got from Amnesty International about
Mexico's current human rights situation:
14 February 1995

                      STATEMENT BY AMNESTY INTERNATIONAL
              REGARDING CURRENT DEVELOPMENTS IN CHIAPAS, MEXICO.

Amnesty International is seriously concerned about current developments in
Chiapas, Mexico, following the detention of alleged members of the Zapatista
Army of National Liberation (EZLN) on Wednesday, February 8; and Mexican
President Zedillo's February 9 detention order of people alleged to be leaders
of the EZLN.

The detention order was followed by Mexican army incursions into the
municipalities of Larra<i'>nzar, Simojovel, Morelia, and other areas on
Friday, February 10, and a restriction of access into the zones of conflict
preventing journalists and independent human rights observers from freely
entering the area.

Amnesty International calls on the Government of Mexico to lift these
restrictions and allow full and complete access to the zones of conflict to
independent observers, including human rights monitors.

Amnesty International has confirmed reports of aerial strafing against
civilian populations in the environs of La Garrucha, the ejido of Morelia, and
the environs of the town of Ocosingo.  Reports have also arrived alleging the
use of torture to force confessions of several alleged members of the EZLN
that were detained by the Mexican Federal Judicial Police on Wednesday,
February 8.  These reports are outlined in an attachment to this statement.

Amnesty International has reports of arbitrary detentions for short periods of
time, including that of two US Citizens, Ruben Cardosa and Robert Treinan.
They were falsely accused of inciting rebellion when in fact they are
free-lance journalists who were in Chiapas when the conflict began anew.  They
were released free of charges shortly afterwards.

In light of a long-standing pattern of human rights violations, particularly
the use of torture, Amnesty International is disturbed by unconfirmed reports
of summary executions, arbitrary detentions, and the use of torture by the
Mexican Army in the course of its operations.  Amnesty International calls on
the Government of Mexico to guarantee that the human rights violations
perpetrated by the Mexican Army in January of 1994 including summary
executions, arbitrary arrest, torture, and torture-killings are not repeated
now.

Amnesty International fears that these events may very well be repeated given
the fact that not one member of the Mexican army was prosecuted for human
rights violations, continuing a long-standing pattern of impunity for human
rights violators throughout Mexico.  Amnesty International documented these
and other violations perpetrated by the Mexican Army and security forces in
the course of missions in January of both 1994 and 1995 and raised its
concerns with government and other officials.

Amnesty International wrote then President-elect Zedillo in October of 1994
outlining a series of recommendations to rectify the human rights situation in
Mexico.  To date, Amnesty International has received no reply.

Representatives of Amnesty International USA today requested an urgent meeting
with new Mexican Ambassador to the United States Jes<u'>s Silva Herzog to seek
assurances of full and immediate respect of human rights both in the context
of Chiapas and elsewhere in Mexico.

_______________________________________________________________________________

Peace,
GABE

>               REGARDING CURRENT DEVELOPMENTS IN CHIAPAS, MEXICO.


I visited Amnesty's web page (io.org/pub/human-rights/amnesty/home.html) &
found NOTHING on the supossed going on's in Chiapas. The problem with this
total anarchy on the net is that people are very quick to beleive &
spread anything that sounds reasonable, especialy if it's some fun
anti-government kinda thing that lets them get all juiced up. There is
absolutely nothing in your post that gives any proof that Amnesty
International actualy wrote it but most people will probably just automaticaly
beleive it just from some name easily typed by anyone, I'm not claiming
that you did though or that this all was definatly mis-information but I
wouldn't be so quick to trust anything somebody sends you.
			josh

believe the worst, expect the best

Question: Who are we going to believe? In war-time, the first victim is the
truth. Which is why it is better to judge things by principles. I think we
can all agree that there already exists a precedent for human rights
violation in Mexico. SO we couldf rephrase the whole debate to "IF THIS IS
AN ACCIDENT WAITING TO HAPPEN - then why wait until people have been
massacred to act???? OR are we only moved by reports and pictures of blood
and guts. There is a military dictatorship on our southern border that is
being supported by the present administration. I think this is a total
disgrace, and quit frankly brings into question the entire American
Legislature. I suggest that if people are in any way upset by the prospect
of a massacre/torture occuring south o' the border, that we complain via
any means at our disposal, instead of having a CHANGE THE CHANNEL
attitude.

-david

and just dancing along with this light bass line.  youd be like:
   "where is the bass?"   and then BOOOOM!  he'd hit you with it :)

It's amazing how everyone thinks *jungle* is so new.  I love
breakbet/jungle/hardcore.. whatever!  But everyone seems to just use the word
jungle because they think it's so new or something...  It's  like always
using the words multimedia, interactive, and online (especially in SF)....

far greater than itself!

Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk



I was attacked twice this weekend.  First, by a posse of office
workers from the Bay Gaurdian.  Then, driving thru the mission a
truck full of teenage gangsters kept trying to stare me down at each
traffic light.  I kept blowing cigarrette smoke in response to this
silly puppy dog like aggression until I noticed his gangster woman
who was, well, kinda cute ...

consequence
another day, 
another fist in your face

These boys piled out of the truck - surrounded the car - and dramatically
grabbed their belt buckles in violent gestures that had something to do with
hiking up their baggy pants.  The police passed through the intersection 
responding to the fairly obvious showdown by flashing their lights and 
driving away.  Green light and we safely continued home.

(getting to the rave part here)
My friend, Trini Lopez, was rather shaken by the roadway incident and, to 
be honest, was in an odd mental state from our evening of anti-rave slumming.
His solution was to haul himself over to the Carpeteria party, throw down his
cash, and look for some family.  He kept mumbling - we're all in this 
together now ...

When I saw Trini the next day he said of the party, "All Intensity, No Unity"
So there is a second-hand review for ya ... I also heard of a digi-after-party 
in a mansion in the lower haight that Sunday morning - details of this would be
interesting - anyone make it?

Dave

	Well we went out this weekend and pertied it up.  We don't know 
where everyone was but we had a great time.  On Saturday night Tim and 
Deaks spun for about five hours at the beach, both were really on.  After 
cleaning up we went to Santa Cruz (from Monterey) and slept for about 
four hours.  Then we got together for out afternoon adventures and 
finally headed up the coast to some cliffs above the water.  We set up 
around four and Deaks started again, at sunset Tim played a few songs and 
then I came on for a little bit.  Just as I was nearing the end DJ Cloud 
showed up and took over when I was done, I missed most of his set but I 
heard only good things about his set!  Then Donut went on for a little 
bit and Josh came on after that...then Deaks spun again for another hour 
or two.  We initiated our new speakers with style in the warm weather and 
I think we decided to definitely do a lot of afternoon outings this 
summer!!!  It was so nice to dance out in the daytime.  

love drenalin

Robert J, to my dismay:)
> San Francisco is the "best of all possible
>worlds, " and  "God is a raver who dances in heaven," (and sometimes at DV8)

So God sez: "Milton, I hate asking for help, but I want to try the SF
scene,you know, all this heavenly party stuff is nice, but techno on harps
bites the big one" so me and Jeff take Him to DV8, at his insistence, since
I personally boycott the joint. But God being God, and me needing a ride,
we went.

So some clown sez he get Him on the guest list, but when we get to the
door, the door dude sez" I don't care if He's Jesus, he's gotta pay" so I
floated god a fiver and we went in. They check his ID and go "Oh my God!"
and we go "ours too!"

At this point, God figured He didn't need any more attitude, and we went
off to the beach to play guitar, and He said:" Milton, you were right. I
shoulda listened to you the first time. Is the End-Up this bad too?"

God is everywhere. Except in a few people who have a propensity to wear
$200 heels and leather vests over their perma-tans.

(DISCLAIMER for the humor impaired: not an actual event. God doesn't need
Milton to get into DV8. Not intended to offend, and whatever the true
nature of your god/gods, I doubt that "He/They" can be miffed so easily.
I'm shure a little chuckle is appreciated by the Big Guy.)

Milton and the E-Bee (doging the wrath:)

Brian sees thru the darkness: 
>remember sitting in a doctors office reading a Time Magazine; I saw a 
>picture of a 7 year old Bosian boy lying on the ground in a pool of his 
>own blood. The caption read boy shot by sniper. What kinda animal lowers 
>x-hairs ona 7 year old and pulls the trigger; I just started crying. When 
>is the violence going to stop; when will people realize that it just 
>doesn't work and only brings more violence.

I saw the same issue at the super-mark-it, and it made me freeze. he was
litlle, chunky and dressed in a puffy blue coat, white fur on the edges,
his mother had probably dressed him up for the cold and told him "stay out
of cross fire" but how in the world could he know some sick paranoid fuck
would deliberately pick him? 

His round little tummy kept his body from sprawling all over the blood, and
there was a stream of it as his life left him. I cried in front of the
whole line. what can I do? I cried more for the evil that one person can
contain, than over the loss of one life. Because that evil breeds and
persists, and that evil makes us the most vile of species. 

And the hope to expell that evil from our hearts is what keeps me smiling,
keeps me hopefull everyday when I wake up, makes me smile when I remeber
all the people I konw that think sorta like me, and that WE ARE EVERYWHERE.

That is a queer bumper sticker, I believe, but I think it should be used by
us and anyone with compassion in their hearts and peace in their souls. 

Lotsa love 'cause that's why we live,
          Milton and the shell-shocked E-Bee....

Subject: Way Cool Vibes!   thanx all.......
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com

I made my first trip into the nighttime streets of SF last weekend, a
bunch-o friends and I drove up to check out  Futur.  Twas cool to meet the
few of those I was able to...the trip came together at the last minute, and
I was struggling to get #'s of many and failed.  So hello, Allen, (Joe Rice
- When ya' gonna get yer pal Frank Isaac online?)  Sorry to those I missed!
Futur was a blast - and damn if we didn't luck into the bestest after-party
ever...w/ keoki, derrick carter, josh wink, dan, charlie, graeme, jaggers,
-n- wade....the place was on McCallister with racks of amps and speakers in
almost every room, I don't even want to go into how beautifully the house
was decorated and all of the great people I met....wowzers!  Oh, the comfy
garden in back was an added treat as were the visuals on monitors in nearly
every room........Let's not even get into how incredible the music
was....MIND BOGGLING!  I even got to tape some of Dan's set, and the only
female to spin (although I neglected to get her name) as the airport
shuttle arrived surprisingly early to wiz us to the airport, since my
girlfriend was unable to partake in the pres's day holiday & we had to
split a day earlier than our friends........

Thanks everyone for being to warm and friendly!

I'll see you again soon!

See ya!   -M

Larry was asking about ambient music events that aren't
connected to the rave culture.  I just heard about something
coming up on March 14th at the Hotel Utah (at 4th and Bryant
in SF).  This is part of the Tuesday night Dark Circle
Improv series, which is mostly the kind of jazz music that
the SF Weekly (the old SF Weekly, that is) was calling the
"New Thing Part II", but on March 14th it's going to be some
pretty well respected local industrial ambient "groups":
Trance and Mandible Chatter.

Subject: Re: Jungle at The Jungle?
To: doom@kzsu.Stanford.EDU (Joe Brenner)
Date: Tue, 21 Feb 1995 16:40:52 -0600 (CST)

In-Reply-To: <199502212148.NAA22818@kzsu.Stanford.EDU> from "Joe Brenner" at Feb 21, 95 01:48:40 pm

Precedence: bulk

> 
> So what do you think?  The connection between Jungle (the
> Jungle that I've heard anyway) and Breakbeat seems a little
> weak to me, though I couldn't put my finger on why exactly.

For some bizarre reason, Jungle is gaining a lot of support down here in
Texas, especially in Houston, so I hear more of it than I care to.  The
jungle stuff down here is defined as breakbeat that's heavy on the bass line
and sparse everywhere else.  I kinda thought breakbeat went away a few years
ago and I was glad to see it go IMHO.  Now this jungle thing has brought it
back.  Jungle has a lot of vocal samples in it, but the tempo is really fast
so all the samples sound like Alvin and the Chipmunks.  I think you kind of
have to be a major spaz to dance to jungle.  (Not that there's anything
wrong with being a spaz :)  

If you're curious about jungle, I'll give you a profile of what fans of
jungle appear to be like.  If what you see doesn't describe you, you
probably won't like jungle.  (Granted this is blatant stereotyping, but it
is in full acknowledgement of exceptions to the rule and is not meant with
any disrespect.)

Junglists are *very* fanatical about jungle, and will fight to the death
with anyone who questions jungle as the *ultimate* dance form.

Jungle is for people who like to totally spaz when they're dancing.  Jungle
is not about a mental trip, but a physical workout.

The junglists I've met are either not into E or any other drugs, or they
prefer speed and other amphetamines.

Okay, I'll stop, because I don't want to dis jungle, it just doesn't seem
very ravey.  I don't get a community feeling from jungle (or just plain old
breakbeat for that matter.)  I don't know, $3 is cheap, check it out and
judge for yourself, just be prepared.  I can't dance to it.  Take care.

Peace/Love/Soul 

solarvibe

I realize I made a lot of stereotypical statements in my earlier post, but
it's statements like these which lead me to these conclusions.  This was
pulled off the txraves mailing list:

> "rave" is dead..its time for da jjjjjjjuuuunnnggggglllleeee;)
> 
>                         .roll tha mad fukin beats.

I take less issue with jungle as a musical form than I do with the
"attitude" that seems to be inherent in jungle.  It seems to completely
disregard the concept of RESPECT which, call me old fashioned, is still
pretty important to me.

My two cents worth.

Peace/Love/Soul

solarvibe

To: Jonathan Tea <solrvibe@bga.com>

In-Reply-To: <199502212240.QAA07971@zoom.bga.com>

> > 
> > So what do you think?  The connection between Jungle (the
> > Jungle that I've heard anyway) and Breakbeat seems a little
> > weak to me, though I couldn't put my finger on why exactly.

jungle is an evolved form of breakbeat. you could still call jungle 
'breakbeat' if you wanted to. 

> 
> For some bizarre reason, Jungle is gaining a lot of support down here in
> Texas, especially in Houston, so I hear more of it than I care to.  The

>From what i know about houston, and friends who live there, breaks (and 
now jungle) have *always* been a part of the scene there.

> jungle stuff down here is defined as breakbeat that's heavy on the bass line
> and sparse everywhere else.  I kinda thought breakbeat went away a few years
> ago and I was glad to see it go IMHO.  Now this jungle thing has brought it
> back.  Jungle has a lot of vocal samples in it, but the tempo is really fast
> so all the samples sound like Alvin and the Chipmunks.  I think you kind of
> have to be a major spaz to dance to jungle.  (Not that there's anything
> wrong with being a spaz :)  
> 

you're not getting it. the Chipmunk theory of dissing breaks has long 
been dissed itself. current jungle does *NOT* include chipmunk samples. 
*listen*. and the tempo is only fast if you listen to it one way...dig in 
there and find the 'secret' funk-vibe and skank away.

> If you're curious about jungle, I'll give you a profile of what fans of
> jungle appear to be like.  If what you see doesn't describe you, you
> probably won't like jungle.  (Granted this is blatant stereotyping, but it
> is in full acknowledgement of exceptions to the rule and is not meant with
> any disrespect.)
> 
> Junglists are *very* fanatical about jungle, and will fight to the death
> with anyone who questions jungle as the *ultimate* dance form.
> 

this is *definitely* not typical.

> Jungle is for people who like to totally spaz when they're dancing.  Jungle
> is not about a mental trip, but a physical workout.
> 

ummm. yes and no. it's not about the speed. and in some sub-genres of 
jungle it *is* a big mental trip.

> The junglists I've met are either not into E or any other drugs, or they
> prefer speed and other amphetamines.
> 

hmm. in places this is correct. see below.

> Okay, I'll stop, because I don't want to dis jungle, it just doesn't seem
> very ravey.  I don't get a community feeling from jungle (or just plain old
> breakbeat for that matter.)  I don't know, $3 is cheap, check it out and
> judge for yourself, just be prepared.  I can't dance to it.  Take care.
> 

not to diss you, but it's apparent that you don't get it, and it's not 
for you (i'll readily admit that there was a little while where i didn't 
get it.

Here's the scoop.

raves hit the UK, with acid house..things progress musically, house, 
techno, 'breakbeat house' (ie early XL recordings releases, happy house 
style)...this 'rave music' becomes the regular style to be heard at raves 
in the UK. it's happy, it's hard..it's great....some artists begin to 
push the envelope..things get faster, harder...a nw type of breaks come 
up, called 'darkside'..songs in minor keys, with screaming women and 
downright scary samples, another sub-genre comes up, 'drum and 
bass'...which is pretty much just that. (i lost the plot around this time 
and just couldn't get into the new-style breaks)...there were still 
people making the old-style 'happy hardcore'(as it's called now), and 
still keeping up with the new trends...but the drum n bass style 
grows...things mellow out a bit and a ragga/dancehall influence (which 
has always been around, really) beings to show prominently...this ragga 
influence (mc's etc) forms 'jungle' as it is today. now 'jungle' comes to 
represent a number of different sub-genres whichi won't go into 
now....the point is, that 'jungle' has essentially been around for a long 
time in different forms..and that it's coming into its own right now. 

The music is strictly a London ting, music made and played in the 
capital. Unfortunately there were some problems in the scene with crack 
being done at parties along with other quite icky drugs,but the people in 
the scene are trying to fight against it...like anyone they believe in 
their scene, are nice people, and just want to play their music and have 
a good time.

does this make sense..?


i really didn't mean the above as a flame...just an education of sorts. :)

mikebee

At 17:58 2/21/95, Michel Battaglia wrote:
>> >
>> > So what do you think?  The connection between Jungle (the
>> > Jungle that I've heard anyway) and Breakbeat seems a little
>> > weak to me, though I couldn't put my finger on why exactly.
>
>jungle is an evolved form of breakbeat. you could still call jungle
>'breakbeat' if you wanted to.
>

I've heard some jungle that's basically sped up breakbeat (time-compressed
or doubletimed hip-hop drum loops) and some that uses some really original
syncopated drum programming that's one step further removed from breakbeat.
The only stuff I've liked has fallen into the latter category.

Joe

>mucha informacion sobre nosotros y me obligaron a decir
>que si conocia a "german" y a "marcos" y qye yo
>aceptara que lo que encontraron en la casa era para
>otras partes de la republica y no para chiapas.
>
>Me mostraron fotografias y me obligaron a decir que los
>conocia.
>
>                Luis Sanchez Navarrete
>Detenido en Yanga, Veracruz el dia miercoles 8 de
>febrero.
>No esta de acuerdo con la declaracion supuesta.
>La declaracion fue firmada con presion y tortura.
>Denuncia que momentos antes de aparecer publicamente,
>estan siendo intimidados por los custodios del
>reclusorio en los pasillos.
>
>Declara:
>que desde hace un ano comenzo a trabajar en el taller y
>no desde hace 11 dias. Que se dedicaba a la soldadura
>haciendo trabajos que no sabia para que eran. El
>salario era de 40 a 60 pesos la semana.
>
>Fue golpeado y esposado.
>Lo encapucharon con una bolsa de lona para asfixiarlo.
>Le jalaron los cabellos y las esposas le dejaron marcas
>en las munecas.
>
>
>               Rosa Hernandez Hernandez
>Detenido en yanga, veracruz el dia miercoles 8 de
>febrero
>20 anos de edad.
>
>Declara:
>no estoy de acuerdo con la declaracion que aparece, que
>en el taller solo llegaba gente a reparar bicicletas y
>que es todo lo que vi.
>
>Cuando me detuvieron me amarraron con cadenas y
>vendaron los ojos. Cuando me subieron al carro me
>amarraron los pies y asi me trajeron.
>
>Luego me taparon con cobija y estuve a punto de
>asfixiarme. Los que me detuvieron no se identificaron.
>
>Al detenernos se nos dijo que eramos parte del ezln.
>Cuando me trajeron me cubrieron con una sabana mojada y
>me dieron toques electricos en todo el cuerpo.
>
>He estado vendada desde que me detuvieron hasta hoy.
>
>                Ricardo Hernandez Lopez
>Detenido en Yanga, Veracruz el dia miercoles 8 de
>febrero
>no esta de acuerdo con la declaracion supuesta.
>Tornero.
>Nacido en puebla
>sabe leer y escribir.
>
>Declara:
>Me hicieron firmar bajo presion y amenazas.
>Que si no admitia lo que me decian me iban a bajar de
>donde me tenian y me iban a volver a pegar. Me tenian
>vendado.
>Cuando entre a la casa vi que golpeaban a los demas.
>Permaneci vendado hasta llegar al reclusorio.
>Fui golpeado cuando fui detenido y vendado de
>inmediato, no me dijeron por que me detenian.
>Nunca se identificaron los agresores cuando lo
>detuvieron.
>No le presentaron orden de aprehension ni de cateo. Le
>hicieron firmar una declaracion que no le dejaron leer.
>No habia defensor de oficio al momento de firmar la
>declaracion.
>Nunca supo donde estaba, de que se le acusaba y por
>que.
>
>                Maria Gloria Benavides
>detenida en tenayuca 30, colonia letran valle, mexico,
>df.
>
>Declara:
>me detuvieron el miercoles 8 de febrero a las 18 horas.
>Estaba sola en su casa.
>Primero tocaron a la puerta diciendo que era un amigo
>de sus suegros. En cuanto abri pense que se trataba de
>un asalto. Fui rodeada.
>No se identificaron al entrar.
>El trato que recibi fue relativamente malo. No me
>golpearon mucho pero si presiones, amenazas, torturas
>con ruido. Incomunicada, me obligaron a hablar a la
>guarderia. Me vendaron los ojos y me acostaron.
>Me amenazaron con lastimar o matar a mi hijo.
>No tenia nocion del tiempo por continuos
>interrogatorios y mucho ruido.
>Me obligaron a firmar las declaraciones. Ellos las
>hicieron. No se me permitio leer las declaraciones,
>creyeron que no estaba en condiciones de hacerlo y una
>persona leyo una parte. No leyo la primera y la ultima.
>Nunca presentaron orden de cateo o de arresto, ni se
>identificaron como policias.
>
>
>*         *         *         *         *         *
>     *
>En estas acciones ordenadas por el procurador general
>de justicia, el sr. Lozano gracia, se violo toda
>reglamentacion existente tanto en las leyes mexicanas
>como en las internacionales reconocidas por mexico.
>Nos ahora presos no fueron detenidos sino secuestrados.
>En todos los casos no se presento, si es que
>existieron, ordenes de cateo, ni de aprehension.
>Los agentes policiacos nunca se identificaron.
>Los detenidos nunca fueron informados de las razones de
>su detenci[on.
>Se les escribieron declaraciones que involucran a
>personas y narran hechos que no reconocen.
>Se les obligo a firmar tales declaraciones sin
>permitirles leer su contenido.
>No hubo abogado de oficio o de confianza de los
>detenidos durante la toma y la firma de su supuesta
>declaracion.
>Todos los detenidos fueron incomunicados, vendados,
>golpeados y torturados.
>Quienes ordenaron y realizaron estas acciones
>cometieron al menos los delitos de: secuestro, agresion
>con amenazas, tortura, asociacion delictuosa y abuso de
>autoridad.
>No se defiende el estado de derecho violandolo.
>
>
>Conf?
>

>Topic 563       Chiapas rebels elude Mexican manhun
>rortega reg.mexico       5:56 PM  Feb 13, 1995
>
>to:       reg.mexico
>               pbrown@labornet.apc.org
>           bclarke@igc.apc.org
>from:  rortega@igc.apc.org
>Chiapas Rebels Elude Mexican Manhunt
>Raul Ortega  2/12/95
>
>Thursday, February 9, MexicoUs President Ernesto Zedillo  made his first
>payment on his 40
>billion dollar bailout by breaking the truce, cutting off peace talks  and by
>announcing arrest warrants
>for the leadership of the 13 month old peasant rebellion. Accusing  peasant
>rebel leaders as unwilling
>to negotiate peace and of stalling  in order to plot a nationwide revolt,
>Zedillo revealed the true
>identities of the Zapatistas masked leadership, ordered their arrest and
>mobilized a military invasion of
>Zapatista held territory. Warrants for twelve Zapatistas were issued on
>charges of sedition, treason,
>terrorism and possessing weapons which only the military is allowed to use.
>The government has
>tried to pin a terrorist label on the Zapatista movement since the movement
>first came to public
>attention by  tying the rebels to the Basque separatist movement, ETA.
>Thursday, Zedillo accused the
>Zapatista leadership of being tied to the National Liberation Army which along
>with Lucio CabaasU
>Party of the Poor was a prominent guerrilla group in the state of Guerrero
>during the late T60Us and
>early 70Us. The Mexican president claimed that two of the top leadership had
>been arrested. Both of
>those arrested denied any connection with the Zapatista army.
> Subcommandante Marcos was neither captured nor  arrested. The army is still
>searching the
>Lacondon forests for him. Several days before the Zedillo announcement, rumors
>were circulating in
>Chiapas that Marcos had disappeared from the sight and that his whereabouts
>were unknown.
>However, on the morning of February 9th, hours prior to the announcement, the
>nationally popular
>Zapatista leader, accompanied by Major Moises, talked briefly with reporters
>in Guadalupe Tepayac,
>a rebel stronghold. He was described as calm and thoughtful. Marcos said that
>nobody knows what
>comes next, but expressed worry about signals he was receiving from the
>government. RSurrender is
>not within our plans,S Marcos said. He thought the government was ready to
>give up dialogue and
>begin military operations. RWhat is coming, if nobody stops it, is guerrilla
>war,S Marcos said. He
>closed the talk saying, Rthat we are going to win.S
> The following day, Friday, Federal troops occupied Guadalupe Tepayac.
>Throughout the state of
>Chiapas, observers reported a state of emergency and troops landing at
>airports. Truckloads of troops
>were reported heading for Zapatista towns. Reuters reported that the Mexican
>army got a possible
>taste of the future when two of its soldiers were gunned down in an ambush by
>several rebels as their
>armored column entered a Zapatista town Reports of fighting have not been
>confirmed because
>journalists have not been allowed to enter zones where the military is
>operating.
> In San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Medea Benjamin, co-director of San
>Francisco's
>Global Exchange,  announced that 6 members of the Peace and Justice, Witness
>For Peace
>delegation, had attempted to go to Morelia ejido to investigate reports of
>aerial bombing by the
>government.  The observers were turned back.
> The government said that Zapatista leader Subcommandante Marcos is Rafael
>Sebastin Guilln
>Vicente, a 37 year old male, whose father owns a small chain of furniture
>stores. Zedillo also gave
>out  the alleged identities of:  Subcommandante  German, Subcommandante
>Vicente,
>Subcommandante Sofia, and Jorge Santiago Santiago. MarcosU family is from
>Tampico, Tamilupas.
>After completing his university work, Marcos went to Chiapas to do social
>service. Rafael Guillns
>mother was reported as saying the he was a good son, but that she had not seen
>him for several
>years.
>Amado Avendaoment, governor of the Zapatista recognized autonomous parallel
>government,
>denounced the Federal invasion and said that war had begun once more. Members
>of the autonomous
>parallel  government were informed that the Federal government had  a list of
>2000 RorganizersS it
>was seeking. Governor Avendao urgently called for more international observers
>to come to
>Chiapas and testify to the events there. According to Elizabeth Wilcox at
>Global Exchange, a group is
>flyng to Chiapas this coming Sunday, February 19. To join the delegation, call
>(415) 255-7296 or
>globalexch@igc.org
> Zedillo alleged the finding of two Zapatista arms caches. One in Vera Cruz
>included 10 hand
>grenades, 8 pistols, 1 Uzi, 5 rockets and 11 plastic bags filled with
>chemicals for making  explosives.
>The cache in Mexico City consisted of two 9 mm pistols, 300 cartridges and
>some Zapatista
>documents. 23 suspected Zapatistas had been arrested by Sunday.
> At present, according to Benjamin, the army mobilization is visible
>everywhere. Benjamin
>described being in the offices of CONPAZ a non-governmental coalition of
>health care workers
>which is playing a key role in monitoring the human rights situation in
>Chiapas. Around midnight
>Thursday, CONPAZ offices in San Cristobal de las Casas were surrounded by
>machine gun bearing
>police who had arrived in cars which had no license plates. CONPAZ workers
>were forced to leave.
>When the CONPAZ workers returned in the morning, they found the offices
>ransacked. Bishop
>Samuel Ruiz, the chief mediator in recent peace talks, CONPAZ members, and
>Father Pablo Romo,
>director of the Fray Bartolome de las Casas Human Rights Center which was also
>threatened by
>armed police, and have made statements indicating that the government
>crackdown is a threat to peace
>and that the Mayan uprising was now at the point of starting up again.
>However, on the 11th Bishop
>Ruiz believed that peace was still possible.
> The move against the rebels is widely seen as a response to regain
>international confidence and
>ease investor questions about ZedilloUs ability to rule the country as well as
>control indigenous rebels.
>Although the move was announced as RsuddenS by the international media, the
>Zapatistas were
>complaining about army moves even before Zedillo made his plan public. Over
>the last couple of
>weeks, rebel leaders spoke of the danger to the peace presented by troops
>moving into the area
>disguised as medical teams.
> The Chase Bank, a powerful US financial institution, reported in January that
>RThe government
>will need to eliminate the Zapatistas to demonstrate their effective control
>of the national territory and
>security policy.S According to the Chase Bank Emerging Markets Group, RWhile
>Chiapas... does not
>pose a fundamental threat to Mexican political stability, it is perceived to
>be so by many in the
>investment community.S
> Zedillo announced that a special session of Congress would deal with the
>subjects of the conflict in
>Chiapas, and of amnesty for Zapatistas who agree to disarm.
> In Mexico City Saturday, Elliot Young reported over 100,000 angry people
>demonstrating in the
>zocalo, denouncing the crackdown and shouting support for the Zapatista
>movement. Cuauhtmoc
>Cardnas, leader of the largest left opposition party declared that ZedilloUs
>breaking of the cease fire
>was going to spill the blood of many Mexicans.
> Protesters marched along the Reforma leaving a trail of graffiti while
>shouting, RSe Ve, Se Nota,
>Zedillo es un Idiota,S  RTodos Somos Marcos,S RDuro, Duro,S and RZapata Vive,
>La Luche Sigue.S
>An opposition party delegate announced that on Monday there would be a motion
>at the National
>Autonomous University to grant Marcos an honorary doctoral degree.
> Reaction to the break off in peace talks and the arrest warrants for the
>Zapatistas was
>worldwide. In San Francisco, a quickly called rally drew almost 200 people.
>The Mexican consulate
>closed its office and issued no reply to the demonstrators. Police, apparently
>forewarned, were there
>in force, even before the demonstrators appeared. Demonstration notices began
>appearing on
>computer bulletin boards at about midnight Thursday, shortly after ZedilloUs
>announcement. The
>Mexican consulate in Sacramento, CA also closed in reaction to demonstrators.
>In  Spain and France,
>demonstrators  closed Mexican embassies.
>Latin Chronicles is edited and published by Raul Ortega with assistance from
>Global
>Exchange and KPOO-FM of San Francisco. For more information write:
>Raul Ortega, 327 Park St., San Francisco, CA. 94110
>rortega@cello.gina.calstate.edu
>rortega@igc.apc.org
>
>Conf?
>
>
>Topic 564       boletin
>laneta:cimac    reg.mexico       9:42 PM  Feb 13, 1995
>
>
>
>
>                 Llaman a movilizarse a las mujeres.
>
>
>Mxico, D.F., 13 de febrero (CIMAC).-Integrantes de la Convenci"n
>Nacional de Mujeres, Mujeres en Lucha por la Democracia, Mujeres
>del Partido de la Revoluci"n Democr tica y Ciudadanas en los
>individual reunidas aqui esta noche decidieron iniciar una serie
>de acciones contra la guerra en Chiapas y llamar a todas las
>mujeres del pa
>s a sumarse a esta convocatoria a parar la guerra.
>    Bajo las consignas de "Todas somos Indias", "Todas somos
>Ramonas", "Todas somos dignas" este 14 de febrero realizaran una
>parada mitin frente a la Procuradur! General de la Rep#blica para
>eigir la libertad de las mujeres acusadas como zapatistas.
>    Exigiran el rechazo a la tortura, utilizada para presionar a
>las detenidas; el respeto a los derechos humanos de las presuntas
>zapatistas y el derecho a dar seguimiento a sus casos, visitarlas
>y obtener informaci"n permanente sobre su situaci"n.
>    En los prximos 4 dias portaran en su ropa, autos, casas,
>distintivos verdes como una manifestacin simb"lica de la
>resistencia contra la guerra y por la eperanza y el futuro.
>    Las mujeres,reunidas en la sede del Foro de Mujeres
>anunciaron tambin que se sumaran el pr"ximo 20 de febrero a la
>jornada nacional e internacional con una parada en el Monumento a
>Cuauhtmoc a partir de las 16 horas y desde ya empezar n a
>volantear por toda la ciudad.
>         En la reuni"n la diputada perredista Adriana Luna Parra,
>Georgina Rangel del grupo Rosario Castellanos y la diputada Ana
>Lilia Cepeda, de Mujeres en Lucha por la Democracia  anunciaron
>que este martes se entrevistar n con el procurador Lozano Gracia
>para exigir la presentaci"n de las detenidas como presuntas
>zapatistas y se comprometieron a dar seguimiento a sus procesos
>hasta lograr su libertad.
>

>Topic 565       accion urgente4
>laneta:cimac    reg.mexico       9:46 PM  Feb 13, 1995
>
>
>
>                  SOLICITUD DE ACCION URGENTE
>
>              San Cristobal de las Casas, 13 de febrero.
>
>     En Comunicado del Comite Clandestino Revolucionario
>indigena-Comandancia General del EZLN, firmado por los
>Comandantes Javier y David y la Mayor ana Maria, y recibido hoy
>en CONPAZ , se relata la situacion por la que estan pasando los
>campesinos e indigenas de las comunidades situadas detras del
>cerco impuesto por el Ejercito Federal, entre los puntos
>se$alados estan.
>
>1. El Dia 11 de febrero, dos lhelicopteros militares arrojaron
>cinco bomcas en los alrededores de Altamirano y de la comunidad
>La Garrucha y ametrallaron varios poblados civiles aledanos.
>
>2. Militares y policias estan deteniendo y torturando a personas
>civiles. El poblado Rosario ibarra, municipio de Ocosindo, fue
>ocupado por el Ejercito Federal el dia 11, durante la ocupacion,
>los soldados amenazaron y torturaron a varios miembros de la
>comunidad, entre ellos a un representante de la comunidad, que no
>fue identificado, a quien se reporta le fue cortado un brazo. A
>las mujeres se les amenazo con asesinar a sus ninos  si se
>negaban a dar informes sobre el EZLN
>
>3. En la comunidad Guadalupe tepeyac, municipio Las Margarita,
>desalojaron con violencia a la poblacion que se habia refugiado
>en la clinica del lugar la cual se encontraba bajo la
>responsabilidad de la Cruz Roja Internacional. Esta institucion
>fue igualmente expulsada de la zona, volando con esto los
>acuerdos de Zona Franca de 1994.
>
>4. En Guadalupe Tepeyac se reporta que desde el dia 10 de febrero
>comenzaron a llegar cientos de vehiculos blindados y soldados,
>apoyados por helicopteros artillados, los que descendieron en
>Aguascalientes, sede de la primera Convencion Nacional
>Democratica; esta misma operacion se repitio en los poblados La
>Garrucha, Champa San Agustin, Santa Lucia, Monte Libano,
>Taniperlas, La Union y otros.
>
>5. Para lograr el aislamiento de la zona el Ejercito Federal
>implemento un cerco militar resguardado con retenes fuertemente
>armados en los que se impide el paso a la prensa y a observadores
>nacionales e internacionales.
>
>    Por todo lo anterior, solicitamos el envio URGENTE de faxes y
>telegramas a las autoridades del Gobierno de Mexico demandando lo
>siguiente:
>
>a) El alto total de las operaciones militares que se iniciaron el
>dia 9 de febrero.
>
>b) El reinicio de la negociacion y el Dialogo para encontrar una
>solucion pacifica del conflicto.
>
>d) La apertura del cerco militar y que se permita la presencia de
>la Prensa y de observadores a la zona de conflicto para verificar
>la situacion de los Derechos Humanos.
>
>e) La investigacion de las denuncias que se hagan en contra del
>Ejercito Federal castigando conforme a laLey a los responsables
>para impedir que se repita la impunidad que aun permanece a la
>violacion de Derechos Humanos durante 1994.
>
>
>Los datos a donde enviar las acciones son:
>
>Dr. Ernesto Zedillo Ponde de Leon
>Presidente de Mexico.
>Palacio Nacional, Mexico, D.F.
>fax. (52-5) 515 47 83 .
>
>Lic. Esteban Moctezuma Barragan
>Secretario de Gobernacion
>Bucareli 99, Mexico, D.F.
>fas (52-5) 5 46 73 88
>
>             Atentamente
>Roger Maldonado,Lic. Miguel Angel de los Santos,Dr. Gerardo
>Gonzalez-
>
>Nota. Favor de difundir el contenido y enviarnos copias de las
>acciones realizadas. fax: (52-967-80272).
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>TEXTO DEL COMUNICADO DE LOS COMANDANTES DAVID Y JAVIER Y DE LA
>MAYOR ANA MARIA, CONOCIDO HOY 13 DE FEBRERO DE 1995 EN SAN
>CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS.
>
>      Comunicado del Comite Clandestino, Revolucionario Indigena,

>
>Eo Comite Clandestino Revolucionario indigena
>Comandancia General del Ejercito Zapatista de
>Liberacion nacional da a conocer lo siguiente:
>
>
>1.- El dia 9 de febrero en horas de la ma$an, cientos de
>vehiculos blindados y de transporte con tripas federales se
>desplegaron hacia la cabecer municipal, Guadalupe Tepeyac del
>Municipio de San Pedro de Michoacan, territorio bajo control del
>Ejercito Zapatista de Liberacion Nacional, el despliegu apyado
>por unos 30 helicoperos artillados, que hicieron vuelos razantes
>y decendieron en Aguascalientes, sede de la CND.
>Las tropas Federales se penetraron a Guadalupe Tepeyac con lujo
